title: Validation in Reactive Forms in Angular | Angular Tutorial
Angular Community Meetup | August 23rd, 2022 | ng-conf Speaker Panel & InnoVint
desc:
PART 1:
A discussion panel with speakers from ng-conf 2022, where expert Angular developers share insights, advice, humor, & honest opinions on how to navigate the ups and downs of being a software engineer.  Panelists included Deborah Kurata, Erik Slack, Kate Sky, Craig Spence, Alisa Duncan, Preston Lamb, & Jordan Powell.

PART 2:
Dan Strengier & Valentin Funk | InnoVint. Talk: Replacing a native iOS app with an Angular PWA- A case study and technical overview

title: Angular - Logout when Token is expired
desc: In this Angular 14 tutorial, I will show you how to logout when JWT Token is expired. You also know two approaches to checking if JWT token is expired or not in Angular.

title: Angular: How could you use Concat RxJS operator to get the results of all inner observables at the same time
desc: I had a scenario in my work project, where I required the results of all inner observables inside the concat operator at the same time, similar to forkJoin operator.

title: Nested Form Group in Angular | Angular Tutorial
Unit Testing View Children decorator | UT Accessing child in parent components | Angular 14 | Part 6
desc:
In this video we will learn How to test View Children decorator with Angular components;
1. How to test view children decorator with Angular components
2. How to test view children decorator using Angular elements
3. How to test the accessing of variables and methods of child into parent in Angular using Viewchildren
4. How to access multiple child components at a time in Angular

title: Building Angular logger in a scalable way
desc: We often need to add logs to our applications. Some of them are for debugging on the client and some needs to be sent to a server to track bugs remotely.

title: ViewChild Decorator | Component Interaction | Angular Tutorial 20
desc: Step by step tutorial on  ViewChild Decorator. The Angular @ViewChild decorator is one of the first decorators that you will run into while learning Angular, as it's also one of the most commonly used decorators.

title: Angular Validation for Mat-Autocomplete input fields - Part 1
desc:
Angular mat-autocomplete is a great option to use in forms, especially when there's a lot of items to display, for example data in JSON format from an API, since it has a search functionality as well. However, its use might bring up a few challenges, especially if you are trying to validate the value of the input selected if it really is an existing value in the list. In this two part series, I will discuss and show the various ways of using the mat-autocomplete feature to handle validation.
(photo: by Franck on Unsplash)

title: Create custom elements using Angular elements & standalone components | Angular 14
S3E1 - Michael Chan on Uniting the Developer Community - Dev.Life
desc: In this, the first episode of the season, we're joined by none other than Michael Chan, an instructor and coach on lunch.dev and host of the React Podcast. He braves the wild seas of polarization of technologies and explores the benefits to be had in uniting the Dev Communities around things that make sense for everyone.
